article_text:
Humana reverses course in Houston

HOUSTON — In a surprise policy reversal, Humana Insurance Co. will begin offering a broad-network health plan in the Houston area, potentially covering thousands who just days ago were shut out of the city’s top hospitals, the insurer confirmed Wednesday.

article_metadata.description: HOUSTON — In a surprise policy reversal, Humana Insurance Co. will begin offering a broad-network health plan in the Houston area, potentially covering thousands who just days ago were shut out of the city’s top hospitals, the insurer confirmed Wednesday.  The Humana bronze plan is scheduled to become available Dec. 18 in the private market through the carrier’s subsidiary, ChoiceCare Network, and will cover inpatient and outpatient care as well as prescription drugs, the company said.  When the individual health insurance market opened on Nov. 1 in Houston, both through the Affordable Care Act’s federal exchange and in the private market, customers and health care providers realized there were no longer any PPO plans offered by major insurers, creating a stunning void where a year before there were 19 such plans.  [...] an email obtained by the Chronicle sent from the company to a Houston insurance broker said, “Humana has decided to launch our Bronze ChoiceCare PPO plan that has been available in other counties across the state in the 26 counties surrounding Houston and Austin that previously had no PPO offerings available to clients.”
article_metadata.author.name: By Jenny Deam, Houston Chronicle

og.description: HOUSTON — In a surprise policy reversal, Humana Insurance Co. will begin offering a broad-network health plan in the Houston area, potentially covering thousands who just days ago were shut out of the city’s top hospitals, the insurer confirmed Wednesday.  The Humana bronze plan is scheduled to become available Dec. 18 in the private market through the carrier’s subsidiary, ChoiceCare Network, and will cover inpatient and outpatient care as well as prescription drugs, the company said.  When the individual health insurance market opened on Nov. 1 in Houston, both through the Affordable Care Act’s federal exchange and in the private market, customers and health care providers realized there were no longer any PPO plans offered by major insurers, creating a stunning void where a year before there were 19 such plans.  [...] an email obtained by the Chronicle sent from the company to a Houston insurance broker said, “Humana has decided to launch our Bronze ChoiceCare PPO plan that has been available in other counties across the state in the 26 counties surrounding Houston and Austin that previously had no PPO offerings available to clients.”
og.title: Humana reverses course in Houston
